member.name: T:tsAudioLib.AudioEntry
member.summary: This class represents an actual entry of the library

member.name: P:tsAudioLib.AudioEntry.Category
member.summary: Audio category: sample, effect, atmo or music

member.name: P:tsAudioLib.AudioEntry.RecordDate
member.summary: Date and time when the audio was recorded/created

member.name: P:tsAudioLib.AudioEntry.Path
member.summary: Path to the actual audio file

member.name: P:tsAudioLib.AudioEntry.Keywords
member.summary: Collection of arbitrary keywords which are neither keyed nor categorized

member.name: M:tsAudioLib.AudioEntry.GetKeywords
member.summary: Retrieves a comma-separated enumeration of all keywords

member.name: F:tsAudioLib.Categories.CategoryType.Sample
member.summary: Marks a raw, unprocessed audio sample

member.name: F:tsAudioLib.Categories.CategoryType.Music
member.summary: This track is a whole song or a piece of actual music

member.name: P:tsAudioLib.MainWindow.Entries
member.summary: Collection of library entries. For testing purposes, it resides inside the view. I might move it to a ViewModel if I decide to go totally MVVM...

member.name: T:tsAudioLib.Meta
member.summary: This class represents a collection of uncategorized metadata. The actual metadata is represented as a dictionary, this class wraps some methods around it for easier access.

member.name: M:tsAudioLib.Meta.Add(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Adds a metadata entry, if no entry with that key exists
